title: 2 Quick Ways to Confirm a Follow Request on Instagram

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app. This is a multicolored camera icon. If you aren't already logged into your Instagram account, do so now. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the heart-shaped icon.
steps.content: Tap the heart-shaped icon. It's at the top-right corner. If you have notifications, you'll see a red dot next to it.

steps.title: Tap Follow request.
steps.content: Tap Follow request . This is at the very top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Confirm.
steps.content: Tap Confirm . This is the blue button next to the user. To remove the request , tap Delete . The user won't be notified, but they'll be able to send another follow request. If you'd like to follow the person back, tap the Follow button that appears. If you can't confirm a request, you may have switched your account between public and private too many times. Try waiting 24 hours before trying to accept again.

steps.title: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ in a web browser. You can use any browser. If you aren't already logged into your account , enter your phone number, username, or email and password to do so now. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Notifications.
steps.content: Click Notifications . This is next to the heart icon in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Follow requests.
steps.content: Click Follow requests . This is at the very top of the page.

steps.title: Click Confirm.
steps.content: Click Confirm . This is the blue button next to the user. If you want to follow them back, click the Follow button that appears. If you can't confirm a request, you may have switched your account between public and private too many times. Try waiting 24 hours before trying to accept again.
